verses.plain: Then Eliphaz the Temanite answered and said,

tokens.t: Then Eliphaz the Temanite answered and said,

verses.plain: Can a man be profitable unto God, as he that is wise may be profitable unto himself?

tokens.t: Can a man be profitable unto God, as he that is wise may be profitable unto himself?

verses.plain: Is it any pleasure to the Almighty, that thou art righteous? or is it gain to him, that thou makest thy ways perfect?

tokens.t: any pleasure to the Almighty, that thou art righteous? or
gain
, that thou makest thy ways perfect?

verses.plain: Will he reprove thee for fear of thee? will he enter with thee into judgment?

tokens.t: Will he reprove thee for fear of thee? will he enter with thee into judgment?

verses.plain: Is not thy wickedness great? and thine iniquities infinite?

tokens.t: not thy wickedness great? and thine iniquities infinite?

verses.plain: For thou hast taken a pledge from thy brother for nought, and stripped the naked of their clothing.

tokens.t: For thou hast taken a pledge from thy brother for nought, and stripped the naked of their clothing.

verses.plain: Thou hast not given water to the weary to drink, and thou hast withholden bread from the hungry.

tokens.t: Thou hast not given water to the weary to drink, and thou hast withholden bread from the hungry.

verses.plain: But as for the mighty man, he had the earth; and the honourable man dwelt in it.

tokens.t: But
the mighty man, he had the earth; and the honourable man dwelt in it.

verses.plain: Thou hast sent widows away empty, and the arms of the fatherless have been broken.

tokens.t: Thou hast sent widows away empty, and the arms of the fatherless have been broken.

verses.plain: Therefore snares are round about thee, and sudden fear troubleth thee;

tokens.t: Therefore snares
round about thee, and sudden fear troubleth thee;

verses.plain: Or darkness, that thou canst not see; and abundance of waters cover thee.

tokens.t: Or darkness,
thou canst not see; and abundance of waters cover thee.

verses.plain: Is not God in the height of heaven? and behold the height of the stars, how high they are!

tokens.t: not God in the height of heaven? and behold the height of the stars, how high they are!

verses.plain: And thou sayest, How doth God know? can he judge through the dark cloud?

tokens.t: And thou sayest, How doth God know? can he judge through the dark cloud?

verses.plain: Thick clouds are a covering to him, that he seeth not; and he walketh in the circuit of heaven.

tokens.t: Thick clouds
a covering to him, that he seeth not; and he walketh in the circuit of heaven.

verses.plain: Hast thou marked the old way which wicked men have trodden?

tokens.t: Hast thou marked the old way which wicked men have trodden?

verses.plain: Which were cut down out of time, whose foundation was overflown with a flood:

tokens.t: Which were cut down out of time, whose foundation was overflown with a flood:

verses.plain: Which said unto God, Depart from us: and what can the Almighty do for them?

tokens.t: Which said unto God, Depart from us: and what can the Almighty do for them?

verses.plain: Yet he filled their houses with good things: but the counsel of the wicked is far from me.

tokens.t: Yet he filled their houses with good
but the counsel of the wicked is far from me.

verses.plain: The righteous see it, and are glad: and the innocent laugh them to scorn.

tokens.t: The righteous see
, and are glad: and the innocent laugh them to scorn.

verses.plain: Whereas our substance is not cut down, but the remnant of them the fire consumeth.

tokens.t: Whereas our substance is not cut down, but the remnant of them the fire consumeth.

verses.plain: Acquaint now thyself with him, and be at peace: thereby good shall come unto thee.

tokens.t: Acquaint now thyself with him, and be at peace: thereby good shall come unto thee.

verses.plain: Receive, I pray thee, the law from his mouth, and lay up his words in thine heart.

tokens.t: Receive, I pray thee, the law from his mouth, and lay up his words in thine heart.

verses.plain: If thou return to the Almighty, thou shalt be built up, thou shalt put away iniquity far from thy tabernacles.

tokens.t: If thou return to the Almighty, thou shalt be built up, thou shalt put away iniquity far from thy tabernacles.

verses.plain: Then shalt thou lay up gold as dust, and the gold of Ophir as the stones of the brooks.

tokens.t: Then shalt thou lay up gold as dust, and the
of Ophir as the stones of the brooks.

verses.plain: Yea, the Almighty shall be thy defence, and thou shalt have plenty of silver.

tokens.t: Yea, the Almighty shall be thy defence, and thou shalt have plenty of silver.

verses.plain: For then shalt thou have thy delight in the Almighty, and shalt lift up thy face unto God.

tokens.t: For then shalt thou have thy delight in the Almighty, and shalt lift up thy face unto God.

verses.plain: Thou shalt make thy prayer unto him, and he shall hear thee, and thou shalt pay thy vows.

tokens.t: Thou shalt make thy prayer unto him, and he shall hear thee, and thou shalt pay thy vows.

verses.plain: Thou shalt also decree a thing, and it shall be established unto thee: and the light shall shine upon thy ways.

tokens.t: Thou shalt also decree a thing, and it shall be established unto thee: and the light shall shine upon thy ways.

verses.plain: When men are cast down, then thou shalt say, There is lifting up; and he shall save the humble person.

tokens.t: When
are cast down, then thou shalt say,
lifting up; and he shall save the humble person.

verses.plain: He shall deliver the island of the innocent: and it is delivered by the pureness of thine hands.

tokens.t: He shall deliver the island of the innocent: and it is delivered by the pureness of thine hands.

footnotes.text: as he…: or, if he may be profitable, doth his good success depend thereon?
the naked…: Heb. the clothes of the naked
honourable…: Heb. eminent, or, accepted for countenance
height of the stars: Heb. head of the stars
whose…: Heb. a flood was poured upon their foundation
as dust: or, on the dust
the humble…: Heb. him that hath low eyes
He shall…: or, The innocent shall deliver the island
